title.narrative: Developing Government Capacity to Build the Evidence Base on Human Trafficking

description.narrative: The project will contribute to eradicating human trafficking, through building the evidence base. Specifically, the project will seek to improve the production and accessibility of new human trafficking data according to international standards and transform new data into evidence for policy-making and programming. The project will complement IOM’s work to establish the Counter-Trafficking Data Collaborative (CTDC), the world’s first multi-stakeholder, public data portal on human trafficking.

sector.narrative: Protection and Assistance to Vulnerable Migrants

policy-marker.narrative: Project with sufficient inclusion of gender issues (mainstreamed)
